docs.snippet: Liberal Zionists who criticize Israel think they’re indispensable, but Israel can and will survive without them....
docs.lead_paragraph: Liberal Zionists who criticize Israel think they’re indispensable, but Israel can and will survive without them.
docs.abstract: Shmuel Rosner Op-Ed article holds Israeli government should not listen to non-Israeli Jews who say war in Gaza has made them question their Zionism; contends Israel can do without support of such non-Israeli Jewish liberals; says Israelis should not gamble their security and lives for the sake of accommodating the political sensitivities of people who live far away.

docs.snippet: Mainstream conservatives ran the table in Senate Republican primaries as tea party upstarts lost all six challenges to GOP incumbents, leaving the establishment upbeat about midterm elections and the insurgent movement beaten but unbowed....

headline.main: Mainstream GOP Upbeat After Sweeping Tea Party
headline.print_headline: Mainstream GOP Upbeat After Sweeping Tea Party

docs.snippet: The arrest of Jason Rezaian of The Washington Post has alarmed the foreign press corps and highlights the split between Iran’s president and the state institutions that hold the real power....
docs.lead_paragraph: The arrest of Jason Rezaian of The Washington Post has alarmed the foreign press corps and highlights the split between Iran’s president and the state institutions that hold the real power.
docs.abstract: Arrest of Iranian-American Jason Rezaian of The Washington Post, along with his journalist wife Yeganeh Salehi, by Iranian authorities alarms the foreign press corps and highlights split between Iran’s Pres Hassan Rouhani and state institutions that hold the real power; Post says it has not been given any explanation for Rezaian's arrest or any information on his condition.

headline.seo: Jason Rezaian of Washington Post and Wife Still Held
headline.main: A U.S. Journalist’s Arrest Points to a Power Struggle in the Leadership of Iran
headline.print_headline: A U.S. Journalist’s Arrest Points to a Power Struggle in the Leadership of Iran
